brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is observe clinical practice including glucocorticoids treatment
      in AECOPD in China.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Practice of AECOPD Management in China
clinical_study.condition: Acute Exacerbation of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
It is widely recognized that the global social and economic burden of Chronic obstructive
      pulmonary disease (COPD) is high; affecting an estimated 64 million people worldwide. It was
      reported the prevalence of COPD in China population over 40 years old is about 8.2% (Zhong
      Nanshan et al, 2007). According to the report on China Chronic Disease, COPD is the second
      disease of Disability Adjusted Life Years.  The economic burden of COPD is tremendous in
      China. Cost analysis in 2006 showed that every COPD patient in urban would pay 1732.24 $ on
      medical cost every year, indirect cost on nurse and traffic is 231.6 $, total cost would
      account for 40% of average family income in 2006(Chiang CH.,2008).AECOPD is one of most
      important cause leading to COPD death. Corticosteroid is essential for AECOPD management and
      recommended by domestic and international guidelines. But it shows that corticosteroid use
      for treating AECOPD in China is around 70% from market research in big hospitals, and less
      report about how steroid is used for AECOPD management was published, including
      distribution, dosage, treatment duration, etc.  The healthcare resources utilization for
      treating AECOPD in China is also unclear.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. ≥40 years old

          2. Hospitalization treatment due to AECOPD since Sep, 2013

          3. Diagnosed by GOLD 2013 as COPD at least 3 months before AECOPD based on treating
             physician's judgment

          4. Provided informed consent or  informed consent waiver

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Participation in any interventional clinical study within 3 months before being
             recruited in the study.

          2. Ongoing AECOPD during recruitment timeline

          3. The patients whose symptoms haven't recovered and then discharge by themselves

          4. The primary diagnosis of hospitalization is not AECOPD

study_pop.textblock:
The patient population will be ≥40 years of age, received hospitalization due to AECOPD
        since Sep, 2013. The patients should be diagnosed by GOLD 2013 as COPD at least 3 months
        before AECOPD based on treating physician judgment.

clinical_study.official_title: A Non Interventional, Retrospective Study on AECOPD Treatment Status in China

other_outcome.measure: Any other significant medical condition or co-morbidities
Onset date of this AECOPD, date of hospitalization, date of discharge
other_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of glucocorticoids treatment for AECOPD
primary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of oral /intravenous/ inhaled steroid therapy in patients treated with glucocorticoids, mean dosage, regimen and treatment duration via different administration route in hospital
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of antibiotics treatment for AECOPD by clinicians during the hospitalization.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality caused by AECOPD and recorded as primary cause of death by clinicians
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of antibiotics treatment via different administration route for AECOPD, mean treatment duration via different administration route in hospital
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Endotracheal intubation rate in treatment of AECOPD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pneumonia rate at the diagnose of AECOPD and in treatment of AECOPD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospitalization duration and treatment cost due to AECOPD as primary cause
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of treatment category before AECOPD and at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical efficacy and safety within different administration route of corticosteroid treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to up to 30 days (Hospital discharge)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Retrospective
